summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena issued to the Interlochen Center for the Arts. The emails discuss the subpoena seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically regarding tuition payments. Jeff Jocks, representing Interlochen, ultimately states the institution has no records of payments by Epstein or his entities and that tuition records are only kept for 7 years.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Jocks
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC who is the primary point of contact for the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is leading the inquiry and issuing the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Attorney (from Butzel Long) who is also involved in the response to the subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts, as he is copied on a key email from the prosecutor.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender who is the primary subject of the subpoena and investigation; the prosecution is seeking records of any tuition payments he or his entities made to Interlochen.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, convicted for her role in his sex trafficking scheme; also named as a subject of the subpoena for records from Interlochen.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Comey) issuing a subpoena and corresponding with the attorney (Jocks) representing the subpoenaed institution (Interlochen Center for the Arts).
Both are attorneys involved in responding to the federal subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Both are named as subjects of the federal subpoena seeking records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Comey, as an AUSA, is investigating Epstein as part of a federal probe, evidenced by the subpoena for records related to him.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey sends a subpoena to attorney Jeff Jocks, addressed to the Interlochen Center for the Arts, seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Interlochen's Final Response
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks informs the U.S. Attorney's Office that Interlochen Center for the Arts has no documents regarding tuition payments by Epstein or Epstein entities and that they only keep tuition payment information for 7 years.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (implied, not directly addressed but is the subject of the subpoena)
310 West Front Street, Suite 300, Traverse City, Michigan 49684 (Law office of Jeff Jocks)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Office of the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to the Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The specific focus of the subpoena was on records of any tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for any students at Interlochen.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, stated the institution had no such records and that tuition payment information is only retained for 7 years.
The email correspondence reveals an ongoing investigation by federal prosecutors into Epstein's financial activities, including potential payments to educational institutions.
Multiple email addresses and names of other prosecutors/assistants are redacted in the document, indicating a broader investigative team.
